Five New Schools opening in the 2017-2018 School Year

a.span: New Student Registration for the Current (19-20) School Year

img.title: Horry County Schools COVID-19 Information and updates
img.alt: Horry County Schools COVID-19 Information and updates

span.p: With the Governor’s declared state of emergency and closure of all public schools until April 30, we will continue to take proactive steps in assisting our school families and students during this time.

We have launched our efforts related to the continuity of operations: employee work expectations, student learning at home, food service opportunities at schools, etc. during the school closure. In the meantime, we will continue to assess this ever-changing situation and communicate any additional decisions that may be necessary as quickly as possible to ensure you are fully informed. We ask for your patience as we prioritize immediate needs and seek large-scale solutions that impact our students, employees, families, and communities.

WiFi Bus Locations and Sites: Beginning on Tuesday, April 21, 2020, HCS will offer Bus WiFi Access for students at multiple locations throughout our district. Also during the extended school closure, internet access is available in the parking lots of any HCS school building. Parking for internet access is allowed in these areas between 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

div.p: As of April 15th, three HCS attendance areas (Conway, North Myrtle Beach, and Socastee) have been impacted by employees who have tested positive for COVID-19, and multiple employees working in the meal program have had to self-quarantine as a result of their direct contact with individuals who received positive test results either last week or today. Consequently, the district will suspend the operation of all 13 grab-and-go meal sites and all bus meal pick-up locations for the next two weeks effective April 16, 2020.

We will assess our meal program following the two-week suspension of service. Parents are asked to monitor the district’s website and social media concerning notifications of when, or if, meal service can resume during this public health emergency.

Words cannot express adequately our gratitude to all of our HCS employees who have served our students as a part of the district’s meal program since March 16th. As of today, their efforts and dedication have enabled us to serve 166,072 meals to HCS students.

Modifications to Student Meal Delivery Sites: Please see the REVISED student meal delivery location and times in the Myrtle Beach and Loris areas, effective Wednesday, April 15. Click here to verify new locations and times.

p.span: On April 9th, the South Carolina Department of Health & Environmental Control (SC DHEC) confirmed for HCS officials that a Nutrition Services employee, who worked at Socastee Elementary School prior to that site’s closure and who was under self-quarantine, has tested positive for COVID-19. This employee’s last day reporting to work was Thursday, April 2nd. The employee was pre-screened by the school nurse, which is done daily, on Thursday, April 2nd, and did not present any symptoms. Horry County Schools cannot share any additional information about the employee and cannot legally disclose the employee's health condition.

Earlier this week, in accordance with SC DHEC guidelines, HCS communicated with all HCS Nutrition Services and Transportation employees who worked at the Socastee Elementary School site regarding an employee’s positive test result. The employee whose positive test was confirmed yesterday was one of the workers who had previously been instructed to self-quarantine. As reported by the district on April 8th, SC DHEC is conducting an investigation.

We want to assure our staff and all of our stakeholders that our number one priority is the health and well-being of our students and employees. Employees are pre-screened by nursing staff each day prior to beginning work, and all food preparation surfaces and equipment are decontaminated daily. Standards for handling food products are followed in the preparation of student grab-and-go meals. Single-service items are also used in many of our food service settings to avoid any contact concerns.

As we all know, the community impact of the COVID-19 virus remains a dynamic and changing situation. Consequently, the district may have to scale back the operation of the current 13 grab-and-go meal sites, as well as the number of bus meal pick-up locations. Every effort will be made to continue our meal program during the spring break period.

Words cannot express adequately our gratitude to our Nutrition Services and Transportation Department, as well as all other HCS employees, whose work and dedication enable us to continue to deliver critical services to the students of Horry County during this public health emergency.

div.p: On April 8th, the South Carolina Department of Health & Environmental Control (SC DHEC) confirmed for HCS officials that a Nutrition Services employee who has worked at South Conway Elementary School during the school closure tested positive for COVID-19. This employee’s last day reporting to work was Friday, March 27th. The employee was pre-screened by the school nurse, which is done daily, Friday, March 27th, and did not present any symptoms. Horry County Schools cannot share any additional information about the employee and cannot legally disclose the employee's health condition.

After consultation with SC DHEC, the site will remain open due to the amount of time the employee has not been in contact with other employees. According to SC DHEC, the amount of time between the employee’s positive test result and the employee’s last day of reporting to work indicate there is no impact on other employees working at the feeding site.

We want to assure our staff and all of our stakeholders that our number one priority is the health and well-being of our students and employees. Employees are pre-screened by nursing staff each day prior to beginning work, and all food preparation surfaces and equipment are decontaminated daily. Standards for handling food products are followed in the preparation of student grab-and-go meals. Single-service items are used in many of our food service settings to avoid any contact concerns.

The South Conway Elementary school meal site remains open at this time. In the abundance of caution, the site and busses will receive additional cleaning and disinfection beyond what is done on a daily basis.

As we all know, the community impact of the COVID-19 virus remains a dynamic and changing situation. Consequently, the district may have to scale back the operation of the current 13 grab-and-go meal sites, as well as the number of bus meal pick-up locations.

Words cannot express adequately our gratitude to our Nutrition Services and Transportation Department, as well as all other HCS employees, whose work and dedication enable us to continue to deliver critical services to the students of Horry County during this public health emergency.

Child Development Application: Applications for child development will be available beginning April 21, 2020, via the Horry County Schools website for the 2020-21 school year. The application window will close May 22, 2020. The website outlines specific documentation that must be provided, as well as instructions for uploading the required documentation electronically.

If you are unable to access the district website to apply for child development, applications with instructions will be available for pick up outside the front door of the elementary school in your attendance area Monday through Friday between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. beginning April 21, 2020.
Parents are reminded that children must be age four on or before September 1, 2020, to apply for child development.
Questions regarding the child development application process can be emailed to cdkregistration@horrycountyschools.net. Parents can also call the school and leave a voice message for a return call.

Kindergarten Registration for 2020-2021: Registration for kindergarten will be available beginning April 21, 2020, via the Horry County Schools website for the 2020-21 school year. The website outlines specific documentation that must be provided, as well as for instructions for uploading the required documentation electronically.

If you are unable to access the district website to register for kindergarten, registration packets with instructions will be available for pick up outside the front door of the elementary school in your attendance area Monday through Friday between the hours of 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. beginning April 21, 2020. Parents are reminded that children must be age five on or before September 1, 2020, to register for kindergarten.
div.div: Questions regarding the kindergarten registration process can be emailed to cdkregistration@horrycountyschools.net. Parents can also call the child's school and leave a voice message for a return call.

div.p: On April 7th, the South Carolina Department of Health & Environmental Control (SC DHEC) confirmed for HCS officials that a Nutrition Services employee who has worked at Socastee Elementary School during the school closure tested positive for COVID-19. This employee’s last day reporting to work was Thursday, April 2nd. The employee was pre-screened by the school nurse, which is done daily, on Thursday, April 2nd, and did not present any symptoms. Horry County Schools cannot share any additional information about the employee and cannot legally disclose the employee's health condition.

In accordance with SC DHEC guidelines, HCS has communicated with all HCS Nutrition Services and Transportation employees who may have had direct contact with the employee. In addition, employees who had direct contact with the employee have been directed to self-quarantine for 14 days. SC DHEC will also conduct an investigation.

We want to assure our staff and all of our stakeholders that our number one priority is the health and well-being of our students and employees. Employees are pre-screened by nursing staff each day prior to beginning work, and all food preparation surfaces and equipment are decontaminated daily. Standards for handling food products are followed in the preparation of student grab-and-go meals. Single-service items are also used in many of our food service settings to avoid any contact concerns.

The Socastee Elementary school meal site has been closed and affected areas will be appropriately cleaned and disinfected. The affected buses will also be appropriately cleaned and disinfected. Effective April 8th, Socastee High School will provide grab-and-go meals for the Socastee area.

As we all know, the community impact of the COVID-19 virus remains a dynamic and changing situation. Consequently, the district may have to scale back the operation of the current 13 grab-and-go meal sites, as well as the number of bus meal pick-up locations.

Words cannot express adequately our gratitude to our Nutrition Services and Transportation Department, as well as all other HCS employees, whose work and dedication enable us to continue to deliver critical services to the students of Horry County during this public health emergency.

Spring Break Reminder: HCS will observe Spring Break from April 10th - April 17th. Therefore, as in a normal year, instruction will cease for this period of time. However, grab-and-go lunch and breakfast will continue for students during this break.

Student Meal Delivery Options: HCS will continue to offer student meal delivery options and pick-up locations during the extended school closure, Monday through Friday. Beginning on Wednesday, April 8, 2020, Socastee High School will replace Socastee Elementary School as a student meal pick-up location. We will continue to notify you if additional adjustments are made. Check back daily for updates. See more

p.strong: Superintendent’s Statement Regarding HCS Graduation and Senior Ceremonies:

div.p: Modifications to Student Meal Delivery Sites: Please see the REVISED student meal delivery location and times, effective Monday, April 6. Click here to verify new locations and times.

New 2019-20 Final Grading Guidance: The State Department of Education has issued guidelines for grading, particularly as they relate to high school courses that grant credits. Horry County Schools is working with the State Department of Education to develop a framework that aligns with the direction given by the state and puts a priority on ensuring seniors can complete all necessary coursework to graduate with their class. Read more.

p.strong: Grading Guidance Relating to Students With Disabilities

div.p: Free Student Meal Waiver: A new USDA waiver enables us to allow adults to pick up meals for a student even if the child is not present. An official roster will be available for parents to document appropriate required information. Learn more about our student meal pick-up/delivery locations and our new interactive map here.

ul.li: Click here to view the COVID-19 Updates Archive

div.p: Horry County Schools vision is to be a premier, world-class school system in which every student acquires an excellent education. Our schools will be welcoming centers organized around high-quality teaching and learning.

Horry County Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, immigrant status, English-speaking status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal or S.C. law in its programs or activities. For questions regarding the nondiscrimination policies call 843-488-6700, or write Horry County Schools, 335 Four Mile Rd., Conway, SC 29526.
